property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: The game starts with a cat looking child waking up in some place they don't know and asking if anyone is here. Your goal is to guide them and ensure their safety.

property.name: description
property.value: The game starts with a cat looking child waking up in some place they don't know and asking if anyone is here. Your goal is to guide them and ensure their safety.

property.name: description
property.value: Right after entering the living room Niko will try to find if anyone is here and there will be no response again.

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Living Room

object.name: Music slows down and gets louder

property.name: description
property.value: In the basement stairs room for a dramatic effect the music slows down by 20% and its volume increases by 10%.

property.name: description
property.value: In the basement the music speeds up by 40%.

property.name: description
property.value: For a dramatic effect, Niko stops and the camera pans towards the lightbulb on the ground.

property.name: description
property.value: A PC asking for a password which is 4 nonrepeating random digits (or a word in [[New Game Plus]]). Unlocking the PC makes it send system messages about the "mission", [[Niko]] and the one shot you got (NG+ proves it wrong and confuses it). The doors will open after that.

property.name: description
property.value: The window letting in the light needed to see the digits on the [[TV remote]]. The digits positions are random. The random aspect is removed and the text changes if the colorblind mode is on in the [[settings]].

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Bedroom

property.name: description
property.value: The door locked until you unlock the computer.

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Bedroom

property.name: description
property.value: The door locked until you unlock the computer. This roadblock was added in [[World Machine Edition]] and backported to the Remake in 2022 to help new players with the remote puzzle.

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Bedroom

property.name: description
property.value: A fireplace with wood that can be set on fire using the [[torch]]. Lit fireplace reveals the [[basement key]] wedged into a crack in the floor.

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Living Room

property.name: description
property.value: The door that can be unlocked using the [[basement key]].

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Living Room

property.name: description
property.value: If the [[lightbulb]] is used on it the lightbulb shaped hole emits a flash of light and then Niko gets teleported to [[Barrens]]. Key presses are needed to advance the cutscene.

property.name: page
property.value: Starting house#Living Room

property.name: description
property.value:
'' '''Before obtaining the [[lightbulb]]:
''' [Dusty books.]
[It's too dark to read in here.]''
'' '''After obtaining the lightbulb:'''
shows an open book with pages blank except for "Ad infinitum" written on the page on the right.

property.name: description
property.value: ''[The tub won't run.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[A pair of luminous, yellow eyes stares back at Niko.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[There's no water in the toilet.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[The sink won't turn on.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[Just a table.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[Just a chair.]''

property.name: description
property.value: ''[Just a chair.]''

property.name: description
property.value: A mysterious giant lightbulb that will later be revealed to be crucial to the plot and the gameplay. Will light up and teleport Niko into a different room which completely replaces the dark basement from now on. Lightbulb is isplayed on [[Niko]]'s sprites after being picked up. The music also stops. The item can be used on the western living room door to leave the house.

property.name: description
property.value: After the fireplace is lit, a small blue glimmer appears. It is the key that can unlock the eastern door.

property.name: page
property.value: Basement key

property.name: description
property.value: The broken TV gives off sparks that can be used to light the [[wet branch]] on fire, making it into a [[torch]].

property.name: description
property.value: A withered potted plant sits here. [[Niko]] can take its [[branch]] which can be combined with the [[bottle of alcohol]] to create the [[empty bottle]] and the [[wet branch]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dry branch

property.name: description
property.value: A lone bottle of alcohol is found inside the refrigerator. It can be combined with the [[dry branch]] to create the [[empty bottle]] and the [[wet branch]].

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of alcohol

property.name: description
property.value: A TV remote is found here on non-[[New Game Plus]] playthroughs. It has the digits of the PC password written on its buttons but it's too dark to see them so [[Niko]] will have to make use of the light coming from the window.

property.name: page
property.value: Television remote

property.name: description
property.value: In the World Machine Edition, you get the Return achievement after Niko walks out of the bed in [[New Game Plus]].
